result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney Charlie Hoffmann in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Nicole Marie Ostrowski in court for Daavion E Lee. 
Defendant Daavion E Lee in court.
Defense does not object to the findings made by Dr. Collins.
State is also in agreement with the findings.
Court will adopt the findings of Dr. Collins and find that the defendant is competent to proceed.
Defense requests to waive the right to a preliminary hearing.
Court conducts colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.
Court accepts the defendant's waiver of prelim.
Preliminary hearing waived, matter is bound over.
Bail remains as fixed.
Information filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waived reading, and enters a not guilty plea.
Attorney Ostrowski requests a hearing date in February, 2023.  Court grants.

dated 08-18-2022, filed by Dr. Deborah Collins requesting an extension to return Competency Report to 09-15-2022.

Review hearing on August 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Signed by Commissioner Costello on 07/11/2022.
Conditions were Modified. CO-SIGNED BY BRIAN BRYANT (DEFENDANT'S FATHER)

CONDITIONS MODIFIED ON 07/11/2022:  TO BE CO-SIGNED BY BRIAN BRYANT (DEFENDANT'S FATHER).  Defendant is no longer required to comply with GPS Monitoring through WCS.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken; and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to have no contact with victim A/witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to have no unsupervised contact with any child under the age of 18.  Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court.  Defendant to surrender their passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) within 24 hours.  Defendant is not permitted to apply for the issuance, duplicate nor renewal of a passport and/or passport card during the pendency of this action.

10:33 AM Defendant Daavion E Lee in court with attorney Nicole Marie Ostrowski.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DEFENSE COUNSEL REQUESTS ORDER FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days.  Attorney Ostrowski notes that Victim A has moved out of the State and it's a joint request to remove GPS Monitoring.  The State confirms that is the request to remove GPS Monitoring.  The Court will modify the bail conditions to remove GPS Monitoring and add the DNA requirement.  The Court will set this matter before the Trial Court for a review on competency.  Review hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on July 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
